title: Strategic Role and Practical Application of Language Instructional Design in Higher Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of linguistics and applied linguistics, advanced expertise in instructional design, and extensive practical experience in language curriculum development
context.additional_context: Requires efficient instructional design strategies for environments with language resource scarcity due to budget constraints. A blended language course (integrated basic grammar, vocabulary, reading, and writing) operating in smartphone-based limited-technology settings.

learning_goals: Learners explain ≥3 core roles of an instructional designer in higher education language contexts: needs analysis, language material development, and assessment system design.

Learners analyze ≥3 language curriculum cases (grammar/vocabulary/reading-focused) under resource constraints, design one curriculum, and achieve "excellent" ratings in ≥4 of 5 rubric items (goal alignment, activity diversity, interactivity, assessment validity, tech integration).
Learners propose detailed designs for smartphone-based language activities (text analysis, voice recording, vocabulary quizzes) in blended learning environments.

Learners analyze three onsite/remote language education case studies, identify ≥3 differences in instructional design (language input methods by environment, feedback types by interaction mode, language proficiency measurement by assessment), and create a comparative table.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
